alert.note: Alert for De Kalb; Steuben (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS NorthernIndiana (Northern Indiana and Northeastern Ohio)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 24 at 5:32PM EDT by NWS NorthernIndiana
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Steuben, De Kalb, southeastern Branch, southern Hillsdale, northwestern Defiance and Williams Counties through 630 PM EDT... At 532 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 10 miles east of Lagrange to near Waterloo to near Huntertown. Movement was northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Angola and Hamilton around 545 PM EDT. Butler and Fremont around 550 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Edon, Edgerton, Montpelier, Reading, Holiday City, Bryan, Pioneer, Hillsdale and West Unity. This includes the following highways... Interstate 69 in Indiana between mile markers 324 and 357. Interstate 69 in Michigan between mile markers 1 and 2. Interstate 80 in Indiana between mile markers 139 and 156. Interstate 80 in Ohio between mile markers 0 and 19. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
